alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles west of Dolores, or 38 miles southeast of Monticello, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Yellow Jacket and Lewis. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 36 and 50. Colorado 145 between mile markers 21 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
